Posts.Content: Derek Jeter soaked inside the adulation from fans and players through 1 much more night on baseball's national stage, set the tone for the American League having a pregame speech then delivered two final All-Star hits. " target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://www.magicalcases.com/"> Custom iPhone 5s Covers, probably the leading candidate to succeed the 40-year-old Yankees captain because the face of the game, seemed ready to assume the function using a tiebreaking triple and later a go-ahead double that earned the 22-year-old MVP honors. On a summer evening filled with reminders of generational change, the AL kept up practically two decades of dominance by beating the National League 5-3 Tuesday for its 13th win in 17 years. ''I feel let Mike be Mike. I don't assume men and women have to necessarily appoint someone to a specific position,'' Jeter mentioned. ''He's got a vibrant future ahead of him. I never know how considerably greater he can get, but if he regularly does what he's performing, then he might be right here to get a long time.'' Miguel Cabrera hit a two-run homer to help give the AL champion home-field benefit for the World Series. Regardless of what else happened, from the begin it seemed destined to be one more particular event for Jeter. He produced a diving quit on Andrew McCutchen's grounder to shortstop major off the game and nearly threw him out initially, then received a 63-second standing ovation when he walked to the plate before his opposite-field double to appropriate top off the bottom half. He was given yet another rousing cheer just before his single to appropriate beginning the third and 2 1-2 minutes much more applause just after AL manager John Farrell sent Alexei Ramirez to shortstop to replace him at the get started from the fourth. As Frank Sinatra's recording of ''New York, New York'' boomed over the Target Field speakers and his parents watched from the stands, Jeter repeatedly waved towards the crowd, exchanged handshakes and hugs with just about every single individual within the AL dugout after which came back onto the field to get a curtain get in touch with. ''It was a special moment and it was unscripted,'' Jeter stated. ''I was unaware of it.'' NL manager Mike Matheny of your Cardinals did not want it to cease. ''The guys on our side have the utmost respect for him and would like to happen to be standing around for any small though longer,'' he stated. ''I consider Derek was the one that was uncomfortable with it.'' Although not as flashy as Mariano Rivera's All-Star farewell at Citi Field last year, when each of the other players left the terrific reliever alone around the field for an eighth-inning solo bow, Jeter attempted not to make a fuss and to deflect the focus. Even in the course of his clubhouse speech. ''He just wanted to thank us,'' Trout said. ''You know, we should be thanking him.''
Posts.Title: Jeter, Trout lead AL over NL 5-3 in All-Star game
